description: Responding to an unusual occurance in outback Australia the Southern Squadron encounter the Uncanny A-men ( a comical parody of many American heroes of comics and tv). Americano ( the first hispanic American heroine with a sonic cry ),America Man ( super patriot ), Stormy Weather (afro American weather contoller and lounge singer) and Slasher ( a bionic sioux chiefton ) all feel persecuted by their country and are seeking somewher else to lay their hats. It contavines federal laws the SQ asks them to leave and the usual misunderstood battle between hero teams ensues. The Squad is on teh recieving end of a hiding until Lt Smith shouts the order"execute team maneuver 3:ba" as usual under her expert tactical briliance and using the maneuver's she has had the team train in they are soon victorious.
name: Moving Home

description:
In the Jackaroo story Jack Keegan has been thrown out of the Australiana, one of his regular watering hole when he's in Sydney. This time however he had gone there because he had learned that the head of the criminal organization extorting his friends business' in the bush, was based there. He had intended to confront him, a man called Barnacle. After being thrown out he decides to break in and see him in his office as the Jackaroo. To his surprise he ends up fighting a killer robot left there to kill the Barnacle.

Dark Nebula faces some "hellspawn" who use his inner fears against him and make him see himself as a destroyer.

The Golden Age Southern Cross tracks Agent Nazi (who has been responsible for sabotage in war producing factories) which ends in a fight on a submarine.

The Southern Squadron participate in a rescue mission in Antarctica.
name: January 89
The Hunt for the Redhead down under

description: Welcome again to the world bizarre: the underground realm of World Below. In this second series, Paul Chadwick continues the quest in the subterranean world where six adventurers are in search of magic technology for the electronics magnate Charles Hoy. What strangeness lurks beneath Washington State? Evil trees, women in white tank tops, helpful chest parasites, and guns. What else does anyone need?!
name: The Spare

description: Weird beyond imagination, tentacled "partners" adopt the league of six adventurers, who now find themselves closer to the secret of The World Below, a cavernous land that may contain the answers to the world's biggest problems. Join Concrete creator Paul Chadwick as he takes us into the strange worlds of real pulp fiction!
name: The Zombies!

description: Dizzy from the effects of the enlightening "partners," the Team of Six stumbles upon evidence of humans. Not to mention a giant brain, evil pigs tethered to a pile of rocks, and a buried robot. Finally! Technology that will sit still long enough to be hauled back to the surface! But it will take soul-searching and a woman's intuition to solve the riddle of "The Brain." And what is it with these bits of human influence strewn about? Read on and find out.
name: The Brain!

description: Here it is, folks. After weeks of searching through a strange underground terrain, the explorers find more than they were looking for: the ringmasters of this crazy and grotesque circus. All of those conspiracy theories about aliens seeding the earth take a different turn, maybe for the worse. The mysteries of The World Below are finally revealed, but will they be worth it?
name: Pets!

description: The dregs of Arcadia's denizens gather on the Waterfront, where anything goes, and usually does. After last week's explosive beginning, Titan is ready to clean up the dirty streets using X as a mop. But first, he has a Monster to manhandle. All this, plus The Scream!

Events resolve themselves this week in Arcadia, but not the way anyone expected. Titan and X pull out their last, best, and most desperate moves to make the bloody decision: Whose rules will the city play by? X's rules, the ones with the guarantee of death behind them? Or Titan's rules of right and justice?

Wracked with gang violence, constant rioting, and bloody battles for a piece of the power, Steel Harborrocks, day and night! This week, it's in Titan's flight plan, but he's about to find out that the music is louder than usual -- in fact, it's earsplitting. The Prime Movers are tearing through Castle Pointe, where the city's rich and influential live, and Strikeback, an all-new character, is on the scene! He can take it, and he can dish it out, but only in that order, and Mace Blitzkrieg has just given him more than he can swallow!

When Titan's in a foul mood he takes it out on the whole city, and his mood today could spell the end for Steel Harbor! It's up to Wolf Gang to keep the most powerful man in the world from destroying Comics' Greatest World! But are even they enough against Titan, whose strength and sheer force of will are expanding exponentially with every second that goes by? At a buck a book this series is the best dollars-to-dynamite ratio comics have to offer!

When Wolf Gang isn't enough to stop Titan from tearing up the city, the heroic forces of Steel Harbor all converge for a muscle-ripping, vein-rupturing, skull-splitting street fight with the world's strongest superhero! Counterstrike takes a beating and keeps on coming, and Wolf Gang and the Prime Movers put aside their differences to take on the seemingly unbeatable hero-gone-mad. Finally, like the cavalry, Motorhead shows up -- but will he save the day, or destroy Steel Harbor?

The government has no options left for dealing with their maverick, super-powered Titan, so Golden City's Amazing Grace steps in and teleports him back to Golden City -- but is she making a big mistake? Once he's back in Golden City, Titan breaks through the last of his inhibitions, and it's up to Grace and Madison to subdue him -- if they can!

Now in Golden City Titan goes after the Catalyst team with grim determination. With Grace there teleporting them in and out of harm's way, will the combined forces of Rebel, Ruby, Warmaker, and Mecha prove successful where the heroes of Steel Harbor failed? Or will Titan succeed in his bid to become the new ruler of Golden City? This twelve-issue series is heading for the final blows and you'll want to be there so you don't feel left out!

With great power comes great destruction! Titan's rampaging through Golden City like a freight train out of Hell, with an unstoppable ego and an attitude to match. He leaves the Catalyst team members licking their wounds and goes after his real target: Grace. All he wants is her surrender, but it looks like he'll have to kill her to get it! Hurt, nearly beaten, and her teleportation diamonds useless against him, Grace is out of ideas and out of time! Or is she?

Titan tears himself away from Golden City to take a bite out of Cinnabar Flats! Grace tries to enlist the help of the alien from the Vortex even as Titan shows up like an angry earthquake, bent on pounding the base to rubble. Division 13, King Tiger, and Hero Zero all want in on the action, but the real threat may come from the underground cells of Block 13, where sedated inmates, mutated by the Vortex years ago, are freed by Titan's attack! The last three issues of this megaseries will draw your attention because Legend creator Mike Mignola draws the covers!

When Titan threatens the power of the Vortex itself, the alien takes notice! The army brings out all its firepower and Titan shrugs it off like popcorn. But it's King Tiger and his otherworldly weapons that stop the rampage. For a man who can crush a tank like a beer can, Titan doesn't have much respect for Tiger's bows and arrows -- until he goes down for the count!

The Vortex alien and Titan face off for the final battle above the casinos of Hoyo Grandé. It's even money as to who will walk away the winner, but one thing's for certain: Comics' Greatest World will never be the same after this issue!

A hard-bitten Japanese P.I. and a scientist's daughter travel to Australia to unravel the mystery of a sentient biochip! A secret research project has gone awry, and both the biochip and Eiko Hirgure's father have disappeared. Together with detective Happo Mitsuri, they uncover an increasingly tangled trail. Who is the mysterious stranger who contacts Happo? What is the sinister organization following the proceedings? And what does a mermaid have to do with all this?

name: Windfall on Mt. G'zoontight; The Invisible Intruder; Star Island Treasure
The Bedeviled Dime; Sidereal Estate

person_credits.name: William Van Horn
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

name: The Oil Pirates; Billions In The Hole; The Phantom Barnstormer!
The Whistling Ghost; Interplanetary Postman; The Daft McDuck

person_credits.name: William Van Horn
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Andra Radiant thinks she has control of Elysia...but power is a deceptive commodity in the land of the First!
name: Two Houses, Both Hers!

description:
• BAR SLUT
  • CRIME PAYS
name: Crime Pays
Sky-High Hi-Jinks; Gyro Gearloose:The Odd Order; Cave of Ali Baba; Gyro Gearloose:The Bird Camera; The Magic Lamp

description: Another sigil stolen! First she took the mark from the barbarian warrior Brath, now Andra Radiant captures a new piece of her past! How will this acquisition rock Andra?
name: A Trip Down Memory's Pain!

description: Scrooge, his nephews, and Launchpad McQuack search for a lost city of gold in Canada's Arctic. Aided by Walking Mountain, an Indian Chief, and pursued by the Beagle Boys.
name: The City Under the Ice; Mythic Mystery
The Billion-Bean Stampede; Gyro Gearloose:The Nose Knows; Scottish Scares!; A Spicy Tale; Unk-Unk

description: • STRUGGLE 2: AWAKENING HEART
name: Iron Maiden

description: Sinbad and company : out of the frying pan and into the fire, fire demons, that is. The guardians of the Temple of Kabrit Amud stand between Sinbad's crew and their goal, and swords are useless against this enemy. A grave price must be paid for removing the Amulet from its resting place. Sinbad has only one hope for success - but at what cost? Back on the island of Ma'rut, Sam continues to fight her new captor and Alorana learns just how much magical power the young woman possesses. But all is for naught, as Sam is at the Queen's mercy with no one to come to her aid!
name: Sinbad and the Eyes of Fire: Part Four

volume.name: 1001 Arabian Nights: The Adventures of Sinbad

description:
Wraparound cover: Clint Langley (A.B.C. Warriors)

  • Droid Life (Cat Sullivan)
  • Judge Dredd - Mutopia (part 1) (Al Ewing - Simon Fraser)
  • Tharg's Future Shocks - The Lie (David Bailie - Nick Dyer)
  • Stalag 666 (part 12) (Tony Lee - Jon Davis-Hunt)
  • A.B.C. Warriors - The Volgan War - Book Three (part 7) (Pat Mills - Clint Langley)

name: Prog 1611

description: • STRUGGLE 1: RUNNING WILD
name: Out Of Blue Sky

description:
The kids, tired and hungry, seek an escape from the horrors of a post-apocalyptic America in possibly the most American place of all: a mall! Will they find anything of substance in the looted halls? And what terror could possibly await them in a shopping center in the barren wastelands of a dead world?

Christos Gage and Pete Woods continue their Cybernary backup tale with part 3 in this issue.
name: Teenage Wasteland, Part 4 - Mallrats

description:
Cover: Simon Davis (Ampney Crucis)

  • Judge Dredd - Mutopia (part 2 - final part) (Al Ewing - Simon Fraser)
  • Stalag 666 (part 13) (Tony Lee - Jon Davis-Hunt)
  • A.B.C. Warriors - The Volgan War - Book Three (part 8) (Pat Mills - Clint Langley)
  • Ampney Crucis Investigates... - Vile Bodies (part 2) (Ian Edginton - Simon Davis)
  • Nikolai Dante - Prisoner of the Tsar (part 1) (Robbie Morrison - John Burns)
name: Prog 1612

description: Whacked! After inadvertently crossing a ghost mafia made up of the most notorious gangsters in history, three of the original Ghostbusters find themselves on the wrong end of a Tommy gun! Dead before their time and consigned to Purgatory, can the gang somehow find their way back to the land of the living? Plus, what happened to Venkman?

Cover: Simon Davis (Black Atlantic)

  • Judge Dredd - Koan (Al Ewing - Paul Marshall)
  • Tank Girl - Skidmarks (part 4) (Alan Martin - Rufus Dayglo)
  • Interview - Steve Roberts
  • Black Atlantic - Rig (part 3 - final part) (Dan Abnett - Steve Roberts)
  • Interview - Gerry Finley-Day
  • Judge Anderson - Biophyle (part 2 - final part) (Alan Grant - Boo Cook)

Graphic novel 04 - Canon Fodder (bagged with comic)

  • Canon Fodder (reprint from 2000ad progs 861-867) (Mark Millar - Chris Weston)
  • Judge Dredd - Rest Stop (reprint from 2000ad prog 1194) (Gordon Rennie - Chris Weston)
  • Pulp Sci-Fi - Feast of Skin (reprint from 2000ad prog 1163) (John Smith - Chris Weston)
  • Covers gallery - 2000ad prog 864 (Gary Erskine: Canon Fodder) - prog 861 (Chris Weston: Canon Fodder) - prog 1194 (Cliff Robinson: Judge Dredd)
name: Meg 278

description: From the pages of the acclaimed fantasy trilogy rides Sir Apropos of Nothing, a cynical knight who thinks far less of the art of chivalry than he does the art of making a buck. In the first issue of this five-part original series written by the novel series’ creator, Peter David, the man in black may be fleeing across the desert, but Apropos is riding across the desert on a horse with no name, seeking out a buried treasure and running afoul of an acclaimed and slightly familiar tower that's somewhat dark.
name: Gypsies, Vamps And Thieves Part One

description:
The nefarious Rem turns Superman into a sleepwalker…and bids him destroy Batman in “Thirty Seconds Over Dreamland.”

  1. Cover by Jose Delbo and Karl Kesel.
  2. "Thirty Seconds over Dreamland" written by Joey Cavalieri, penciled by Jose Delbo, inked by Alfredo Alcala, Ian Akin and Brian Garvey, colored by Nansi Hoolahan and lettered by Duncan Andrew.

Notes:

  • The events in this issue occurred before the Crisis on Infinite Earths mini-series.
name: Thirty Seconds over Dreamland

description:
" Mr. Freeze bids farewell to Gotham City via a permanent deep freeze! Both Batman and Bruce Wayne must determine Freeze's motives in order to stop him from icing all of downtown Gotham!"--DC Solicitation. 
 
Cold Snap Part 2.
 
Batman discovers Freeze's real motives about stealing those seemingly random items, he was punishing himself for almost forgetting Nora, and now was trying to surround himself with all things that reminded him of her and hopefully dying with her memory, Batman tried to save him but the place exploded, Batman got out and was pretty sure that Freeze had gotten out too.
name: Cold Snap, Part 2 of 2 (Cold Burn)

volume.name: Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight

description:
Logan (Wolverine) takes a holiday in Rio De Janeiro, Brazil, during Carnaval, the festival honoring the spirits of the dead. His first stop is to the Central Police Precinct to visit Detective Antonio Vargas, an old friend who, years before, had owned the 'Devil's Grill', a watering hole where he had employed Logan as a bouncer. Vargas is overjoyed to see Logan, but he also expresses his frustration at so far being unable to solve a series of murder he refers to as "vampire killings".

Another detective interrupts the two men with news of the discovery of several new victims. Logan accepts Vargas's invitation join him at the crime scene, a grotto on the shore. As they view the bodies floating in the inlet, a shark, attracted by the blood, leaps from the water at the pair. Logan slashes at it with his claws, killing the predator.

In a run-down chapel outside the city, an aged man called Saint Cyrus Leviticus converses with a voice only he can hear. His companion, a woman named Ezra Asher, expresses derision at what she views as his schizophrenia. He angrily responds that just as she thirsts for blood, so he hungers for the spiritual energy he expects from the Carnaval celebrants.

That evening, Logan attends the festivities, partying hard into the wee hours. Needing a brief respite, he ducks into an alleyway, where he is confronted by a gang of 'bate-bola boys' who intend to beat and mug him. Eager to brawl, Logan joyfully lays into them.

The next morning finds him sitting in a café, recuperating from the night's activities. Vargas arrives and Logan offers his services in the contiiuing investigation. As they walk through the streets, Vargas talks about his wife, who had disappeared years earlier, and whom he presumes is dead.

Not far away, the bate-bola boys lie in their flat, trying to recover from the beating delivered by their would-be victim hours earlier. Suddenly, Ezra appears, hanging upside-down outside their window. Intending to have sport with her, they move toward the window. But as they come closer, she flashes her fangs and leaps in, biting one of the gangbangers. She makes short work of them and then feasts on their blood.

Later, having come up empty on the case, Logan and Vargas retire to a bar for drinks. Later still, the inebriated pair stumble to Vargas's apartment, where they find two strangers within. One of the bate-bola boys, now a walking corpse, knocks out Logan from behind with a baseball bat. The male intruder, Cyrus, tells Vargas his investigations have brought the detective to his attention, sealing his fate. As Cyrus leaves with the punk, the woman, Ezra, kisses Vargas, and then tells him to look into her face. When he does, he recognizes her as his missing wife. She then clamps her fangs onto his throat.

When morning arrives, Logan comes to, only to find the blood-drenched corpse of his friend. He also recognizes the lingering scent of Vargas's long-lost wife.

The next day, following the funeral, Logan takes it upon himself to track down the killers. After hours of searching, he and the dead bate-bola boys find each other. They clash, and this time, Logan fights for his life. But the gang spreads toxic fumes which overwhelm the X-Man, rendering him unconscious.

When he comes to, he finds he's bound to a pew in the run-down chapel Cyrus uses as his base. He also sees several of Ezra's bite marks on his flesh. Cyrus approaches Logan and begins to speak of immortality and the higher destiny that awaits those live forever. He then lifts his cloak to reveal that his body has symbiotically bonded with a hideous alien creature, his 'other', with whom he has been conversing. Cyrus tells Logan he plans to send his zombies on a killing spree on the final night of Carnaval, so he can feed on the psychic distress of the murder victims, bringing about some form of ascension. He then exits with his minions, leaving Logan alone with Ezra.

She begins to feed on Logan again, but he breaks free from his chains, and they savagely attack each other. When Logan gains the advantage, Ezra leaps out through a window. Logan does not follow, instead opting to trail Cyrus and the zombies. He reaches the city and faces dozens of the creatures.

Logan defeats the undead mob, and then finds Cyrus on a rooftop overlooking the festival. Logan attacks him, but Cyrus fights back, holding his own and managing to overpower the feral mutant. With his plan gone awry, Cyrus intends to have his symbiote feed on Logan, but once the alien is exposed, Logan slashes it and kills it. He then impales Cyrus upon his claws, while the crowd below cheers, thinking the struggle is merely a performance.

The next day, Logan makes one last visit to Vargas's grave, and then leaves on a motorcycle, while Ezra watches from the branches of a nearby tree.

[Note: Inker Eduardo Alpuente is mis-credited on the inside cover credits as writer.]
name: Black Rio

description:
BLOODLUST--A band of drunken vigilantes pursues a crazed psychopath across the icy Yukon waste...they're not taknig any prisoners.

BLOODLUST--A race of mystical creatures descends on the Canadian north...hungry for souls.

BLOODLUST--The mutant Wolverine, a clawed berserker lost in an arctic blizzard--out of his mind.

BLOODLUST-- A dark descent into animal savagery.

--Taken from the summary on the back of the book.
name: Bloodlust

description:
Everything you ever wanted to know about one of the most popular members of the outlaw band of mutants known as the X-Men. The Feral and ferocious Wolverine.

In this first volume find out about the people, places and things that have affected this mysterious, yet popular mutants life. A must for every Wolvie fan.

Zee realizes that his entire life has been a lie and he must face the one man who holds the answers, the man who wants him dead - Daedalus! As the surviving street racers try to pick up the pieces following a brutal attack, the true identity of the Corporation's spy is revealed.
name: Ghost Of The Wasteland, Part 4

description: Decimated by betrayal, the street gangs unite for one final act of rebellion. The Corporation lets Daedalus loose on the streets, as they spin their web of destruction. Will Zee fulfill his legacy? The Freedom Formula race is full throttle, and the prize is survival.
name: Ghost Of The Wasteland, Part 5

description: Robotech's New Generation launches into action as a large-scale war erupts against the Invid. In the year 2038, Earth has fallen to the fearsome forces of the mysterious Invid race, but Admiral Hunter's expeditionary force is about to unleash its first strike to reclaim their homeworld! Plus, Part 1 of the backup story "Mars Base One," set 35 years earlier as the United Earth forces begin building its first top-secret colony on Mars.

Following a fierce battle with the Invid, Lt. Lance "Lancer" Belmont awakens on Earth in the home of Carla Morales. Trying to piece together what happened to the rest of the fleet, Lancer makes some startling discoveries about his location, but also faces grave danger as Invid Sentries begin searching for him! Plus, in the gripping backup tale, Karl Reiber begins to unravel the real secret behind Mars Base Sara!

Yoshitaka Amano's lush ethereal paintings of magical creatures, spirits, goblins, and apparitions have been praised and admired all over the world. In Fairies he turns his considerable talent to capturing in breathtaking images characters from such beloved stories as Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream, the wizard Merlin and his muse the intoxicating Nimue, mermaids of the deep as well as his interpretation of fairies from Celtic and Japanese mythology.
name: HC

person_credits.name: Yoshitaka Amano
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Now, at last, HERO is ready to be released! One of the most acclaimed and award-winning artists of his time, Yoshitaka Amano debuts his first American comics project since Sandman: The Dream Hunters and Elektra-Wolverine: The Redeemer. One of the original concept artists for the Final Fantasy series of video games, along with creation and design of characters such as Vampire Hunter D and Gatachman (known as G-Force, or Battle of the Planets in the United States), Amano now focuses his creative vision on his own creation Hero! In Hero Chapter One: From New York to Paris, he searches for the woman whose love he has never doubted, Hero crosses history and continents. Hero needs to know the reasons why his beloved Lady begs his forgiveness, and only by following her from Parisian cemeteries, to the Las Vegas strip and to Kyoto, can he hope to discover the truth - not only of his own love story but also of his Lady's betrayal. Accompanied by Victor Noir, an assassinated Napoleonic truth-teller, and tormented at every turn by Rudra, a shape-shifting mischievous demon, Hero seeks out his forgotten past. Featuring lavish, full-page illustrations, accompanied by text by writer Jessie Horstig, Hero is at last complete and ready to debut, appealing to comic fans, fiction readers, and manga enthusiasts alike.
name: Party of One

person_credits.name: Yoshitaka Amano
person_credits.role: writer, artist, penciler, inker, colorist, cover

description:
• ZEITGEIST
  • BLOOD RAPE OF THE LUST GHOULS
name: James O'Barr

description:
• BLEEDING HEARTS
  • NIGHT CITY
name: Chaingang

description:
Salad Daze!

  Bushroot turns all of St. Canard's vegetables into his minions.   originally printed in Disney Adventures 199204
 
 

Sara's Invention

 
Darkwing helps test out Dr. Bellum's new robot, the RNOT-M2, which ends up going haywire.  Originally printed in Disney Adventures 199205
name: The Hunt for the Redhead down under

description: The first Venus War is over. Though Ishtar's campaign against Aphrodia was a success, Ishtar suffers from internal warfare as rival factions struggle for control of the postwar political landscape. With the regular military and the powerful Security Police claiming separate loyalties, Ishtar is a powder keg with a very short fuse. Could the flush of martial success abroad help strike the match of civil war at home? The Venus Wars II is a fascinating study of power politics and political intrigue combined with the all-out spectacular action that made The Venus Wars a must-read for manga fans as well more mainstream readers.

Though Ishtar has defeated Aphrodia in the colonial war on Venus, internal political struggles threaten to push Ishtar toward civil war. As two parties grapple for control of the hearts and minds of the populace, cadet Matthew Radom finds himself caught in the middle as shadowy, power-hungry figures set in motion a high-stakes game of subterfuge and assassination.

The two leading political rivals on colonial Venus are dead -- one of a heart attack, the other by an assassin's bullet -- leaving a dangerous leadership vacuum. Cadet Matthew Radom accidentally uncovers information that leads him to believe that the two deaths are connected and that a monstrous conspiracy has been set in motion. His suspicions are confirmed when he finds his car being tailed -- by a homicidal speeding semi!

After barely escaping a suspicious highway accident, Matthew happens across Lupica, a friend from his school days. His car totaled, his life a shambles, he accepts her offer of a ride and refuge. Is their meeting really a coincidence -- or is she, too, part of the web of conspiracy closing ever tighter around him?

Matthew and Lupica are hiding out at a disreputable "love hotel" when a knock at the door awakens them. Helen MacLuth of the Terran Space Force has been tailing them! She wants to make a deal with the two fugitives -- but a squad of Rado's assassins also has plans for them!

Helen MacLuth of the Terran Space Force barely escapes an ambush set up for Matthew at the love hotel, only to find a more subtle -- but no less dangerous -- challenge at the Terran Consulate! Matt's old flame Luisa has come for a visit, but may have more on her agenda than Helen suspects.

Luisa, Matthew's former flame, beats a hasty retreat after shooting Helen MacLuth at the Terran Consulate! Manipulated to kill by Rado, Luisa has acted in order to spare Matthew. Now she finds her own life in danger by the double-crossing Rado! While Matthew and Lupica race to the rescue, so do doctors, as they operate to save Helen's life!
Having been set up as an assassin, Luisa is driven to the warehouse district by Rado's men. It seems as if she's outlived her usefulness. Can Matthew and Lupica rescue her in time?

Matthew and friends steal a helicopter to take the fight directly to Rado! It's challenge enough for this ex-cadet to pilot an unfamiliar machine, but can he handle an aerial battle with pilots whose orders are -- shoot to kill?

Matthew's helicopter has crashed and his attempt to avenge Luisa has failed. He and his friends seek refuge in a remote biological research station with its strange host, Dr. Coli. His mysterious past has led to his exile here to experiment on vats of seething bacteria. Now his isolated home is in peril, as Rado's troops come to finish them off once and for all!

Matthew and his friends resort to desperate measures as Rado's troops invade the biological research station where they're hiding out. Turning their meager resources into weaponry, they repel the troopers, then issue a challenge to Rado: face them in person -- if he dares!

Matthew and his friends have holed up at a remote biological research station, and have threatened to release toxins into the atmosphere unless Rado meets with them. As the nation breathlessly watches, he arrives with the media in tow. The treacherous Rado has a trick up his sleeve, though, as he prepares to finally put an end to his nemesis, Matthew!

The consular palace explodes in a burst of flame as Rado's hidden bomb goes off. Matthew is on his way to hide out from Rado's faction when he hears of the rebellion. Suddenly, his car is stopped at gunpoint by the dreaded Security Police! Things are looking grim for the last hope of freedom on Venus!

On his way to hide from Rado's coup, Matthew's car is stopped by the Elite guard, Matthew's old unit! The tables are turned as suddenly Matthew finds himself leading a counter-rebellion as the ultimate confrontation between him and Rado begins!
It's panic in the streets as counter-revolutionary forces challenge Rado's coup! Matthew and Rado confront each other for the last time. Don't miss this thrilling final issue of The Venus Wars II!

In a world where monsters inhabit man’s deepest nightmares, evil has one name to fear: legendary monster hunter Van Helsing.

Dark Horse Comics introduces a new horror comic book series inspired by Van Helsing, the upcoming major motion picture from Universal Pictures. In this special debut issue we find Van Helsing in Paris investigating a series of brutal mutilations. He confronts a mad doctor whose bizarre experiments have created a horrifying creature dwelling in the shadows of the sewer system.

Dark Horse brings together Joshua Dysart, co-creator of the cult-hit Violent Messiahs and writer of DC’s new series The Demon: Driven Out, and artist J. Alexander, creator of Sirius’s Empty Zone series and recent contributor to Tales of the Vampires. No strangers to monster comics, Dysart and Alexander dig deeper into the mysterious world of the legendary character Van Helsing.
name: One-Shot

volume.name: Van Helsing: From Beneath The Rue Morgue

description:
Tin Tin kills Bea (an old woman) Ratso and Fat Eddie. 

The Crow meets up with Tin Tin to deliver revenge. He then stops by to pay his respects to Top Dollar, who after The Crow dispatches everyone else in the room tires to bargain for his life.  Just like Tin Tin is doesn't work.
 
The Crow relives the time he was known as Eric Draven and his love with Shelly Webster.  It goes through there romance until she is shot in the head while she is making love with Eric by the Skull Cowboy.
 
The Crow (Eric Draven)  reminisces about happier times with Shelly Webster, and when he presented her with the wedding ring that would play into the later parts of the story. Eric catches up with Skank and Tom Tom, from which he learns the location of the wedding ring at "Gideon's Pawn" Shop. 
 
He then goes to Gideon Resale and gets back Shelly's ring.  He also kills Gideon and blows up the pawn shop.  Not before however he talks with Albrect about his wife and tells Albrect to send a message to Captain Hook.
 
On his way to his next target Funboy he bumps into Sherri and gives her Shelly's engagement ring and tells her he is going to send her mother Sandy Skin back home.  He meets up with Funboy who is with Sandy and does at he promises and tells Funboy that they will meet at the Gin Mill.
name: Vol. I - Pain & Fear

description:
First comic book appearance of Donald Duck.
Note: need better scan.
name: Donald and Donna
